ygData.subject: Re: Test of Truth info
ygData.msgSnippet: I imagine there is a protocol of which title to use.  From my days in the Army: brigadier general, major general, leiutenant general, and general all of which
ygData.messageBody:
I imagine there is a protocol of which title to use. From my days in
the Army:

brigadier general, major general, leiutenant general, and general all of
which are referred to as "general" when saying "yes general"

sergeant major, command sergeant major, command sergeant major of the
army, all are reffered to as "sergeant major" when saying "yes sergeant
major"

So I am guessing you choose the "highest" title when addressing someone
with three titles? dunno

-----Original Message-----
From: David Rogers [mailto:derogers334@...]
Sent: Friday, May 28, 1999 1:39 PM
To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Test of Truth info

<snip>

And finally (those crazy British nobles), if there's a
military title too; it goes before them all; though it
would be a rare occasion to use all three titles when
refering to the individual:

Captain Sir Hamish Alexander
Captain Earl Sir Hamish Alexander
Captain Dame Honor Harrington
Captain Lady Dame Honor Harrington

<snip>
